The time is now to join the Wingate family and become part of the fastest growing independent university in the state. Wherever your interests lead, we'll help you follow your dream. Say Yes to Wingate and start your journey.

According to the Cooperative Institutional Research Program, 96 percent of first-year students entering Wingate in 2017 said the University's good academic reputation was important or very important in their decision to attend Wingate.
Judge and reality show star Tyyawdi Hands to speak at MLK event

Wingate will honor a faculty member, staff member and a student who exemplify the values of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. at the University's Jan. 16 MLK Celebration. The event, free and open to the public, will feature a speech by N.C. District Judge Tyyawdi Hands as well as music from the United in One Gospel Choir and the Elizabeth Baptist Church Youth Praise Team.
Take a look back at a decade of growth and change
Marketing students go above and beyond for local nonprofit

In the fall semester, a team of Wingate students served as the de facto marketing agency for Union Diversified Industries, a Monroe nonprofit that provides work opportunities for special-needs adults. UDI was overjoyed with the results.
Atrium administrator inspires fall grads with universal, personal truths

"Don’t let your circumstances limit your success; find a way to serve; invest in yourself; and stay true to your values." These core pieces of advice were handed out to graduates by Commencement speaker Phyllis Wingate, Atrium Health's northern division president. Wingate awarded more than 200 degrees during its third December graduation, held Saturday morning in Cuddy Arena.
Fall Commencement: Hard work nets All-American Verpelli a 4.0 GPA
After spending time on the pro tour, Michela Verpelli found a home at Wingate. She made the most of her time here, becoming an All-American and making straight A's to boot.
Wingate freshman coordinates effort to stock classrooms in Title I schools
Isabella Walle is in her element leading Chalk it Up to Love East, which provides teachers in less-affluent public schools with paper, glue, scissors and many other staple items.
Once a comms professor, Yarbrough (’83) now helps thwart cyberattacks on DoD

Even as a communications professor, Chuck Yarbrough was always the guy who could help you get your computer going again. He reinvented himself as an IT guy in the '90s, and now he's on the front lines keeping the nation safe from cyberattacks.
Wingate No. 11 in the nation for study abroad
Even after being reclassified as a doctoral-level institution, Wingate continues to rank among the best in the nation in giving students opportunities to study internationally.
Wingate students band together to serve hundreds at health fair
Event connects families with host of free services.
Flu shots, screenings and more offered at Health & Wellness Fair

Connecting area families with health resources is the goal of Saturday's Health & Wellness Fair being hosted by Wingate University, Monroe Middle School and Heart for Monroe. Students from all of the University's health science programs will put their knowledge to work for a healthier community.

Florida State’s Mike Martin, the winningest Division I coach in college baseball history, attended Wingate Junior College before earning his bachelor’s degree at FSU. He won Wingate University’s 2004 Distinguished Alumnus Award.

Wingate, a comprehensive, independent and growing university, serves more than 3,600 students in North Carolina. Founded in 1896, the University offers 35 undergraduate majors as well as graduate and professional programs. Wingate is home to the Cannon College of Arts and Sciences, the Levine College of Health Sciences, the Byrum School of Business, the Thayer School of Education and the School of Sport Sciences.

The Enrollment Management Team works to find the right financial aid solution for you. Grant, scholarship, student loan, and work-study opportunities help make a Wingate University education affordable. Please contact your enrollment officer if you have any questions. Together, we’ll help find a way for you to become a Bulldog.

To apply for financial aid, you must first complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid, better known as the FAFSA. The FAFSA application is available beginning October 1, and we recommend that you complete it by March 1.
If you have questions about how to apply for financial aid, you can always contact your enrollment officer at 800-755-5550.
Associate Director, Transfer and Special Admissions

Congratulations on being accepted to Wingate University. To secure your place in the incoming class, you’ll need to use this secure online form to pay the security deposit of $300. The deposit tells us you’re serious about becoming a Bulldog.
The form itself is safe and secure. Just have your credit card ready and follow the simple directions. If you experience any issues when completing and submitting the form, please call

Wingate, a comprehensive, independent and growing university, serves more than 3,600 students in North Carolina. Founded in 1896, the University offers 35 undergraduate majors as well as graduate and professional programs. Wingate is home to the Cannon College of Arts and Sciences, the Levine College of Health Sciences, the Byrum School of Business, the Thayer School of Education and the School of Sport Sciences.
The majority of students pay between $10,000 and $20,000 per year for tuition and room-and-board. Most commuters pay between $2,000 and $9,800.
Approximately 98% of our Undergraduate students receive some form of academic scholarship during the Admissions process.
On average, our students borrow a total of $25,600 during their entire Wingate career, significantly less than the national average of $37,172. (Forbes)
And our graduates pay down their debt at a rate higher than the national average. (College Scorecard)
Most students say a Wingate education is worth the cost and nearly all are satisfied with the Wingate experience, according to the Bulldog Poll.
Wingate students from North Carolina received more than $5.8 million in NC Need-Based Scholarship funds in 2017.
Master of Arts in Teaching in Elementary Education
Master of Arts in Education in Elementary Education
Easy payments are a smart way to budget and pay your tuition.

We understand family finances and the challenges of paying educational expenses. It’s not always easy to pay everything at once, so we offer tuition options, including an interest-free monthly payment plan.

The Wingate University payment plan spreads your tuition over eight equal monthly payments (four payments per semester), making it easier to fit tuition payments into the family budget. A small annual fee of $75 is required to enroll in the program.
You’ll enjoy peace of mind knowing that the payment process is safe and secure. That lets you focus on more important things, such as enjoying life as a Wingate University student.
Interested? It’s easy to get started. Just call the Business Office at 704-233-8211 if you have any questions. When you’re ready to enroll, complete the online
Monthly Payment Planner and Enrollment Form
. You can pay by check, Visa, MasterCard or Discover.

Do I need to complete the FAFSA?
When will I receive my financial aid information?
How do I apply for financial aid to attend Wingate University?
What information is included in my award package?

We recommend that you complete the application for your first year, even if you do not think you will qualify for financial aid. After you see how much federal, state and institutional financial aid you’re eligible to receive, you can decide if you want to complete it again in subsequent years.

We’ll mail your financial aid award package approximately four weeks after you submit the FAFSA and have completed the enrollment process with the Office of Admissions.  Award packages are issued on a rolling basis beginning in February.

Complete the FAFSA annually and be sure to include the Wingate University school code, 002985. The FAFSA is available beginning October 1.  We encourage you to complete the application before our priority deadline of March 1.

Your award package will outline the various types of aid for which you qualify. This may include a combination of academic scholarships, need-based grants, federal loans and/or work-study eligibility.
How do I get a copy of my IRS tax return transcript?
I didn’t file a tax return for the year in question. What do I do now?
How do I submit my forms once they’re completed?

Please don’t be concerned if the Department of Education or Wingate University selects your FAFSA for verification. You haven’t done anything wrong. This is a standard procedure that many students are asked to complete to confirm the accuracy of the data you submitted on your FAFSA. Verification requires you to submit additional information, such as tax return transcripts or other information, before a final decision is made on your financial aid eligibility. We will notify you of any additional information you need to provide.
There are three ways to get your tax return transcripts:
By phone: Call the IRS Tax Transcript Center at 800–908–9946. Your paper transcript should be mailed in 5–10 business days.
. Select “Get Transcript Online.” Request your tax return transcript for the year in question. You should be able to immediately view and print your transcript.

Via Short Form Request for Individual Tax Return Transcript (Form 4506T-EZ): Download the form. Don’t complete Section 5 (Release to Third Party); you want the transcript mailed directly to you. Mail or fax your request to the office specified on the second page of the form. Your paper transcript should be mailed in 5–10 business days.

You are still required to complete the verification worksheet. You’ll need to attest to the fact that you didn’t file and/or won’t be filing a Federal Tax Return for the year in question and that it wasn’t necessary for you to do so. You’ll also need to submit any additional documents that have been requested, such as copies of all of your W-2 forms from employers.
You have three options for submitting your forms:
By mail: Office of Student Financial Planning PO Box 159 Wingate, NC 28174-0159
Via email: Communications sent via email must be encrypted.  Click

The Enrollment Management Team works with you to find the right financial aid solution, including helping you through the financial aid process, from how to complete your FAFSA to learning the details of your award package.
We’ll help you navigate grants and scholarships, student loans and work-study opportunities to make a Wingate University education affordable for you.
Please contact your enrollment officer if you have any questions. Together, we’ll help you find a way to be a Bulldog.

Times available to fit your schedule
Also let us know if you're interested in:
Having a meal in the dining hall

Early fall is a great time for high school seniors to visit campus. Bulldog Scholars Day, which includes a briefing from President Brown, panel discussions and more, is held in late September. (Be on the lookout for an email invitation). If you miss it, no worries, you can still sign up for a personalized campus visit during which you'll be able to check out the dining hall, library, academic buildings, the fitness center and a residence hall. Our student-led campus tours are a great chance to ask questions and get a first-hand feel for Bulldog life.

Future Scholars Day is designed just for motivated high school juniors and sophomores who've previously expressed interest in Wingate and want to learn more. You'll hear President Brown's Briefing on  Financial Aid and Scholarships, attend panel discussions and tour campus with a student NaviGATEtour. This event is a great way to get a head start on exploring Bulldog life. The next Future Scholars Day will be held on March 14, 2020. Look for your invitation closer to the event date or contact

Spring is a great time for admitted students to visit campus and get a better feel for Bulldog life. That's why we've designed Become a Bulldog Day just for admitted students who could benefit from more information before depositing. You'll get a closer look at academic programs, financing a college education and campus life. Panel discussions featuring students, alumni and faculty are a great way to learn what to expect as an enrolled student. You'll get a real feel for our nurturing Bulldog community when you tour campus and enjoy lunch with faculty. The next Become a Bulldog Day is scheduled for March 28, 2020. Check your inbox for an invitation in the spring or contact

Fall semester classes continue through Dec. 2, with the exception of Fall Break, which is Oct. 7-8. The spring session runs from Jan. 8 to April 27, with the exception of Spring Break, which is March 2-6. Visits are available on days when classes are not in session, but if you'd like to meet with faculty or attend a class, you'll want to keep these dates in mind.
